column1: There are many causes of hallucinations, including: - Being drunk or high, or coming down from such drugs as marijuana, LSD, cocaine (including crack), PCP, amphetamines, heroin, ketamine, and alcohol - Delirium or dementia (visual hallucinations are most common) - Epilepsy that involves a part of the brain called the temporal lobe (odor hallucinations are most common) - Fever, especially in children and the elderly - Narcolepsy - Mental disorders, such as schizophrenia and psychotic depression - Sensory problem, such as blindness or deafness - Severe illness, including liver failure, kidney failure, HIV/AIDS, and brain cancer
For example, how long the hallucinations have been happening, when they occur, or whether the person has been taking medications or using alcohol or illegal drugs.
